title: Fill in the blank question for learnr tutorials — question_blank
code: question_blank(   text,   ...,   type = "blank",   correct = "Correct!",   incorrect = "Incorrect",   try_again = incorrect,   allow_retry = FALSE,   random_answer_order = FALSE,   placeholder = "Enter answer here...",   trim = TRUE,   rows = NULL,   cols = NULL,   style = "tutorial_question",   options = list() )

title: Fill in the blank question for learnr tutorials — question_blank
text: text Question option text ... parameters passed onto learnr answer. type Type quiz question. Typically can automatically determined based provided answers. Pass "radio" indicate even though multiple correct answers specified inputs include one correct answer still correct. Pass "checkbox" force use checkboxes (opposed radio buttons) even though correct answer provided. correct question, text print correct answer (defaults "Correct!"). answer, boolean indicating whether answer correct. incorrect Text print incorrect answer (defaults "Incorrect") allow_retry FALSE. try_again Text print incorrect answer (defaults "Incorrect") allow_retry TRUE. allow_retry Allow retry incorrect answers. Defaults FALSE. random_answer_order Display answers random order. placeholder Sample text appear blank. trim Logical determine whitespace answer removed.  Defaults TRUE. rows, cols Defines size text input area terms number rows character columns visible user. either rows cols provided, quiz input use shiny::textAreaInput() text input, otherwise default input element single-line shiny::textInput(). style can change display question "notes" "exam" options Extra options stored question object. useful using custom question types. See sortable::question_rank() example question implementation uses options parameter.

question_wordbank( text, ..., choices, wordbank = NULL, box = 6, arrange = "random", type = "wordbank", correct = "Correct!", incorrect = "Incorrect", loading = c("**Loading:** ", text, "


"), submit_button = "Submit Answer", try_again_button = "Try Again", allow_retry = FALSE, random_answer_order = TRUE, style = "tutorial_question", options = sortable::sortable_options() )

title: Word bank question for learnr tutorials — question_wordbank
text: text Question option text ... parameters passed onto learnr answer. choices vector choices remain stationary left column. wordbank vector choices placed blanks providing options answers. NULL wordbank set equal answer choices. box number 1 11, inclusive, indicating width 'choices' box. default 6 corresponds 50% page width. arrange either 'random' 'ordered'; default random. Set equal ordered want wordbank list appear alphabetically. type Type quiz question. Typically can automatically determined based provided answers. Pass "radio" indicate even though multiple correct answers specified inputs include one correct answer still correct. Pass "checkbox" force use checkboxes (opposed radio buttons) even though correct answer provided. correct question, text print correct answer (defaults "Correct!"). answer, boolean indicating whether answer correct. incorrect Text print incorrect answer (defaults "Incorrect") allow_retry FALSE. loading Loading text display placeholder question loaded. provided, generic "Loading..." placeholder elements displayed. submit_button Label submit button. Defaults "Submit Answer" try_again_button Label try button. Defaults "Submit Answer" allow_retry Allow retry incorrect answers. Defaults FALSE. random_answer_order Display answers random order. style can change display question "notes" "exam" options Extra options stored question object. useful using custom question types. See sortable::question_rank() example question implementation uses options parameter.
